Articles.Content:
Hello, my fellow Kerbalers,

My name is TheCloverLord, though you can call me Clovie, and I'm a high school student from Australia. I want to get into aeronautical engineering and figured that this game could help me with that. Currently I only have the demo but I'm looking for a part-time job so I can get the full game and a decent rig to play it on.

Happy flying, and I'll see you in the next one.

Hello Clovie, and welcome to the forums!

We have a very international forum, with many members who are interested in both aeronautics and engineering.

Glad to have you aboard.

Happy landings!

Hello from Upover to Downunder!

When you look north at noon, the sun burns your nose, right?

When i look north at noon the sun burns my bu... errrm.. backhead ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)!

Hi Clovie!

I too want to get into aerospace, but my story is different: I'm inspired by the game, not visa-versa. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

You don't really need a decent rig to play it on. I play it on an old MacBook, and it works. I *am* looking forward to U5, though.

You might also want to check out Orbiter. It's more realistic, but can be confusing.

If not, take a look at the Realism Overhaul Mod.

Happy Kangaroo boxing!
